title: Advanced Functions and Transformations

vocab.definition: Change in function position, shape, or orientation on coordinate plane
Moving function graph up or down by adding constant
Moving function graph left or right by changing input value
Flipping function graph across axis or line
Expanding function graph vertically or horizontally

teachingNotes: Use graphing technology to visualize transformations. Connect algebraic changes to graphical effects.

sample.question: What changes function position or shape on coordinate plane?
What moves a graph up or down?
What moves a graph left or right?
What flips a function across an axis?
What is any change to a function graph called?
What transformation adds a constant to the output?
What transformation changes the input value?
What makes a graph wider or narrower?

truefalse.question: A vertical shift moves the graph up or down.
Adding a constant inside the function creates a vertical shift.
A reflection flips a function graph across an axis.
A horizontal shift changes the function's output.
A vertical stretch expands the graph away from the x-axis.
Function transformations always change the domain.
Multiplying the function by -1 reflects it across the x-axis.
A horizontal stretch makes the graph narrower.
Adding 5 to f(x) shifts the graph up 5 units.

multiplechoice.question: What flips a function graph across an axis?

fillintheblank.question: A _____ shift moves a graph up or down.
A _____ shift moves a graph left or right.
A _____ flips a graph across an axis.
A _____ expands the graph vertically or horizontally.
Any change to a function graph is a _____.
f(x) + k creates a _____ shift of k units.
f(x - h) creates a _____ shift of h units.
f(-x) reflects the graph across the _____-axis.
af(x) where a > 1 creates a vertical _____.

shortanswer.question: Describe what happens to the graph of y = x when it becomes y = (x - 3).
expectedAny: the graph shifts 3 units to the right

shortanswer.question: Explain the difference between f(x) + 2 and f(x + 2).
expectedAny: f(x) + 2 shifts up 2 units while f(x + 2) shifts left 2 units
first is vertical shift up, second is horizontal shift left
adding to output shifts up, adding to input shifts left

shortanswer.question: How does multiplying a function by a negative number affect its graph?
expectedAny: it reflects the graph across the x-axis
creates a reflection over the horizontal axis

shortanswer.question: What transformation changes y = |x| to y = |x| - 4?
If f(x) = x, what is the transformation for g(x) = 2x?
Describe the transformation from y = x to y = (x + 1).
What happens when you apply both a vertical stretch and a reflection?
expectedAny: the graph stretches and flips across the x-axis

shortanswer.question: How can you tell if a transformation is horizontal or vertical?
expectedAny: changes to input are horizontal, changes to output are vertical
inside the function is horizontal, outside is vertical
x changes are horizontal, function changes are vertical

shortanswer.question: What is the result of applying f(x - 2) + 3?
expectedAny: horizontal shift right 2 and vertical shift up 3
moves right 2 units and up 3 units

shortanswer.question: Why does f(x + h) shift left instead of right?
expectedAny: adding to input moves opposite direction to reach same output
the inside change works opposite to expectation
the graph shifts left to compensate for added value

wordProblems.question: A company's profit function is P(t) = 1000t where t is time in years. If they start tracking 3 years late, the function becomes P(t - 3) = 1000(t - 3). Describe this transformation.
The temperature T(h) = 70 - 2h gives temperature at height h. If the ground temperature increases to 75 degrees, the new function is T(h) = 75 - 2h. What transformation occurred?
expectedAny: temperature increased by 5 at all heights

wordProblems.question: A ball's height is h(t) = -16t + 64t. If thrown from a 10-foot platform, the function becomes h(t) = -16t + 64t + 10. What transformation is this?
The cost function C(x) = 50x represents cost in dollars. If prices double, the function becomes C(x) = 100x. What transformation occurred?
A wave function is y = sin(x). When shifted to start at x = π/2, it becomes y = sin(x - π/2). Describe this transformation.
The population P(t) = 1000(1.05)^t models growth. If we look back 5 years, we use P(t + 5). What transformation is this?
A spring's position is y = cos(t). When inverted, it becomes y = -cos(t). What transformation occurred?
The profit is P(x) = 100x - x. If costs decrease by $50 per unit, the function becomes P(x) = 100x - x + 50. What transformation is this?
expectedAny: profit increased by 50 at all levels

wordProblems.question: A function models distance d(t) = 60t. If measured from a starting point 20 miles ahead, it becomes d(t) = 60t + 20. Describe the transformation.
The voltage V(t) = 120sin(t) is halved to V(t) = 60sin(t). What transformation occurred?
